intro: Murdannia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited murdannia, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and some aquatic species. The plant features slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its showy, violet-blue flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces large, fleshy berries as its fruit. Murdannia macrocarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands.
